subcategory: Perceived lack of credibility in external DEI communications
description: This refers to the situation when the intended audience does not view an organization's messaging and communication efforts in DEI as trustworthy or dependable.

content.text: Organizations invest more time and effort in creating hype about DEI practices but have limited investments in concrete initiatives.
Organizations need to be aware of how they are perceived by both employees and customers and maintain a realistic positive image.
Organizations need to be open in their communication and convey negative information, e.g., mistakes should be highlighted, in addition to positive messages.
When communicating important information externally, organizations need to replace managers with employees when selecting spokespersons.
